article_title: Shatel: Visit to Des Moines hoop site reminds that Omaha set an attention-grabbing standard
article_text:
Wells Fargo Arena in Des Moines has good views and all the usual amenities, but it doesn’t have much room to maneuver.

Previous Next Shatel: NCAA seeks spacious venues — like Omaha’s Kansas players Perry Ellis, left, and Devonte' Graham walk to a news conference ahead of a second-round men's college basketball game in the NCAA Tournament. Shatel: NCAA seeks spacious venues — like Omaha’s Kentucky coach John Calipari returns an autographed ball to a young fan during practice for the team's first-round men's college basketball game in the NCAA Tournament. View all 3 images in gallery.

Posted: Saturday, March 19, 2016 12:00 am

Posted in Sports, Local-sports, Tom Shatel on Saturday, March 19, 2016 12:00 am.

og.description: I was going to go to the NCAA tournament in Des Moines with an open mind. This was the city’s first swing at this incredible event, and Iowa’s biggest city swelled with Iowa pride. I wasn’t going to compare everything to Omaha. But the more I travel, the more I see what we have in Omaha.

Wells Fargo Arena in Des Moines has good views and all the usual amenities, but it doesn’t have much room to maneuver.
